item.title: @elonmusk: Did you know that Tim Kaine -- yes, that Tim Kaine, Hillary Clinton's running mate in the 2016 elect...
item.description: Did you know that Tim Kaine -- yes, that Tim Kaine, Hillary Clinton's running mate in the 2016 election -- is, right now, as we speak, on the board of directors at NED?

item.title: @elonmusk: We are told welfare is supposed to help people climb the ladder & achieve the American Dream, BUT: ‚Ä¢...
item.description: We are told welfare is supposed to help people climb the ladder & achieve the American Dream, BUT: ‚Ä¢ About 54% of Somali-headed households in Minnesota receive food stamps, & 73% of Somali households have at least one member on Medicaid. The comparable figures for native-born American households are 7% & 18%. ‚Ä¢ Nearly every Somali household w/ children (89%) receives some form of welfare.cis.org/Report/Somali-Immigr‚Ä¶

item.title: @elonmusk: üö®üá∫üá∏ SENATOR MCCORMICK CO-SPONSORS MIKE LEE'S SAVE ACT REQUIRING PROOF OF CITIZENSHIP TO VOTE "Voting...
item.description: üö®üá∫üá∏ SENATOR MCCORMICK CO-SPONSORS MIKE LEE'S SAVE ACT REQUIRING PROOF OF CITIZENSHIP TO VOTE "Voting is a fundamental right reserved for U.S. citizens. Pennsylvanians deserve elections they can trust." The bill passed the House last April and has been sitting in the Senate collecting dust. With more co-sponsors signing on, it might actually move. Huge W for election integrity. Source:@DaveMcCormickPA@BasedMikeLee

item.title: @elonmusk: üá®üá≥üá∫üá∏ ELON: CHINA'S SOLAR SURGE IS HALF OF THE U.S. POWER "China's production capacity for solar is 1...
item.description: üá®üá≥üá∫üá∏ ELON: CHINA'S SOLAR SURGE IS HALF OF THE U.S. POWER "China's production capacity for solar is 1500GW/year. They're deploying over 1000GW/year of solar. For a continuous solar load, you divide that by roughly 4 or 5. That's around 250GW of steady state power paired with batteries. That's half of the average power usage in the U.S. China can provide steady state power, and batteries can do half of the U.S. electricity output per year just for solar. Solar is by far the biggest source of energy." Source:@elonmusk, WEF
